#hl3

The length and difficulty of Half Life were the only bad things about this game in my opinion, since I'm not one for a challenge and just like to experience the campaign, but that doesn't stop this game from being one of the best games I've ever played. At first I wasn't sure if I liked Half Life 1 or 2 more, the second game definitely has the better story, but this game reminds me of when I used to play DOOM so the games are equally as good in my opinion.

As someone who never had the 'nostalgia factor' when playing this game, and also as someone who's primary interest isn't really in the FPS or survival shooter genres, I will be the first to say I am probably not the best critic to be reviewing this game. At all.

Yes it was difficult (especially the final boss, where the only good thing that came out of my hour long rage was a bit of entertainment for my friend who was watching my suffering), yes the game is glitchy and yes knowing what to do next in order to advance can be difficult, especially when you accidently kill a NPC because you mistook them for an alien.

But that being said, a lot of those frustrating elements actually made the game enjoyable for me. The difficulty was challenging but I liked the fact you can save at any point and pretty much retry the difficult bits over and over. I liked the lack of hand-holding in this game since a lot of games that I've played tend to walk you through everything, and I liked the overall feel of the game and the story progression. 

Now, as I said before, my review on Half-Life is pretty meaningless and I have no idea what i'm even talking about since this isn't my usual genre, but I do recommend this game and I had fun playing it

This is a fantastic fps which has creative level design full of brilliant puzzles which can leave you scratching your head for a long time until the satisfaction of finishing one kicks in. Even if the puzzles look hard, they never seem overwhelming. I also loved how nerve-wracking the game can be. Often, I found myself peaking around corners to see if a creature was waiting for me. I also felt suspense when a creature would spawn in right next to me or behind me. Because of this, I had to stay alert every time I'd ride up in an elevator, pull a switch, or hit a button. While a lot of this game is linear, it doesn't feel that way as there's a lot of freedom in terms of roaming around in a section of a map before you figure out how to advance to the next section. In addition, I liked how the marines had a really smart AI as they're programmed to react to every move you do. This can make fighting them quite a difficult task. I also liked the little touches such as walking in a room or around a corner to see a scientist or a security guard get killed. And, of course, you can't forget about the G-Man. I've seen multiple people create theories on his character, but my issue with most of them is that they feel more like speculation and loose connections based on certain set pieces. I'm sure we can assume he isn't human, but other than that, there isn't much to work with. I prefer to just appreciate the mysterious beauty conveyed by his presence as I find the game more interesting when I do that as opposed to searching for loose theories on him.

It's certainly true what they say ...This [i] is [/i] one helluva game. 
Truly [b] legendary! [/b] A [i] must [/i] play, even if just for the story alone. 

There's probably something for everyone in here ...O.K. maybe not [i] literally. [/i] But, you have your shooty shooty, platforming/puzzles, a [i] fair [/i] bit of RP, mystery, gotcha moments, boss fights (can be a challenge until you figure it out (like in an MMO? hehe)), etc. 

Sure, there is some bits that make you /sigh and go 'meh' but [i] really, [/i] it's all stuff you'd expect from a 90s game (graphics, difficulty, etc). Anyway, it's tolerable! The story, setting, diversity and uniquity, etc, etc, [i] more than [/i] make up for it. Oh, and it did give birth to one,  [i] truly [/i] awesome reality/universe, filled with lots of lore. So, y'know, my advice? Buy it, spend some time with it, caress and appreciate it ...Get to know it a little and eventually you'll fall in love with it, begin to care about it and want more of it. 
Half Life 2, 3 (soon), etc. 

This is the Alpha, my friend! The Omega has yet to come. 
Remember, it's [i] never [/i] too late to Half Life! :-) 

P.S. I played using the HL: Gold mod (which enhances graphics/models).

Half-Life has been called one of the best PC games of all time by many people, and for a good reason. This game is a masterpiece that should be completed at least once by every gamer. Half-Life is a classic FPS game with gameplay that still holds up remarkably well. Graphics aside, the gameplay is fun and fast-paced, with my only complaint being the Xen levels later on towards the end of the game. I didn't experience any bugs throughout my playthrough, and you should have no problems getting this up and running on modern operating systems. 

I highly recommend Half-Life to anyone who is looking for a fantastic game with an excellent single-player campaign.

Só é chato que não tem legendas em português, quem não entende inglês terá um pouco mais de dificuldade.

Overall, its a fun, fast-paced, shooter with classic appealing graphics.

[h1]Неудачный эксперимент[/h1]

Игра повествует о том, что может случится, если случайным образом открыть врата в другую реальность и что может оттуда придти.

Valve умела делать хорошие игры, а серия Half Life вообще легендарная. Это начало интересной истории, которую должен пройти каждый. Думаю хоть однажды вы слышали о Фримене и о его любимом ломе, который решает все проблемы. Так вот это все отсюда.

Kinda hard to believe the game is 20 years old this year. There are some moments where it shows its age, (like all those vents that seemingly lead nowhere) but overall, this is a fun, fast-paced shooter that places gameplay above narrative, but also manages to deliver said narrative without ever removing the player from the game's control completely. (Save for one 20 second instance.)

It's worth playing through, even if just for the historical information. Just don't treat it as a cover shooter.

Ah o Half Life oque dizer desse jogo que marco minha infância cara. Sábados de manhã deixava de sair pra brincar pra jogar esse jogo debaixo das cobertas naqueles PC ultra mega super fuckin pc da xuxa branco, era o piratão q vinha com o CS 1.6. Bom vamos para a análise....A história resumidamente você é um ciêntis da BLACK MESA, você começa o jogo indo pro seu trampo de quebrada tlg cachorro nakele pike segunda de manhã, ai você temque por uma pedra (eu sei q nao e uma pedra mais fdc to com sono e nao quero explicar vlw amiguinhu) ai ce vai la bota a ''pedra'' no bagulho e da pau na maquina mlk......  Ai começa a abrir portais de narnia para black mesa com aliens te oferecendo um bagulho magiko muito loko e é seu dever encontrar o responsavel pelos portais..... Ai os tira ficam sabendo q vc ta lokao de goiabada e vem pra cima com o BOPE irmao E ISSO MEMO NAO VAI SAI NIMGUEM...... E o resto ? O RESTO E BURACO LADRÃOOOOO HAAAAA VAI PRA ATIMOSFERA TRUTA (mano caguei ce tem erro de portugues pq aki o baguio e loko) i eu to no parkinhu ca minha prima recomendo demais

Half-Life, el eterno de Valve, el juego revolucionario, el sin tercera parte.
Todos sabemos quien y que es Half-Life, es el juego que revoluciono un genero en el PC gaming y fue el hijo de juegos iniciales como DOOM o QUAKE.
Half-life puede verse como algo simple y soso ahora mismo, pero hace unos años era algo impresionante, habia hecho un agujero en la industria que cambio todo en unos segundos.
Tenia una historia planificada que pasaba en tiempo real, que se lo podia ver por nuestros ojos y no mediante cinematicas  que quitaban la experiencia y la ambientacion, tenia una IA compleja, con varios codigos que mostraban como debian reaccionar en ciertas ocasiones, tenia una variedad de armas y escenarios que mostraban lo vivo que era este universo.
Half-Life, es uno de los mejores juegos que pude haber jugado y que deberias de jugar, porque esto marco algo en mi y en la industria.
Half-life, es especial y unico.
Half Life işte fazla söze gerek yok :)
Albeit dated graphics, this game will always remain a classic. It's really well-written, and due to it's age, it doesn't need some high-end computer to run smoothly!

I remember I used to have this game on disc for Playstation, but my dad screwed up the CD. I could never get past crawling into the control room after the place goes to shit before the game would crash and say it was unreadable. I Played that first segment SO many times, this brought so much nostalgia. Also, satisfaction for actually beating the game. It's a classic game that shows it's age as much as it shines above more modern shooters. I love this game to bits, if you haven't played, dont speak to me till you finish it.

FPS的经典中的经典
想当年还是[strike]脑残[/strike]小学生时便玩过
然而当时[strike]太脑残了[/strike]不知开电梯是按E，卡关之后只得扔在一边
时至今日再来品味，方才感受到其中的美妙
虽然二十年前的画质如今显得low逼，但丝毫没有妨碍到我被其魅力吸引，熬着夜打通了关
精妙的关卡和谜题设计，引人入胜的情节编排，在今天看来也格外优秀
只是在那危机四伏又似乎走不到尽头的黑山研究所中战斗给人的感觉有些压抑
个人认为这大概是一款每个FPS玩家都应该玩一下的游戏

Multiplayer as of May 31st 2018 is still alive and kicking (to a certain degree). Single Player still as good as it ever was and a must play. Works well on overkill computers and Windows 10. My Mac and my Linux machines love this game. Hell even a simple netbook can rock this game.

What I'm trying to say is you have no reason to not play this game unless FPS games aren't your thing, then I don't know what to tell you.
